name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: It shouldn’t surprise anyone that Trump wants to “terminate” our Constitution—he orchestrated an attack on our democratic process on Jan. 6th. Anyone opposed to our Constitution is unfit for office.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: We need to protect the freedom of the American people to vote at every level—that means passing federal protections like the Freedom to Vote Act and continuing to work to undo state laws intended to suppress voters.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: People spreading the Big Lie and those who attack our freedom to vote are the biggest threats to our democratic process. The American people resoundingly rejected election deniers in the midterm elections, but we can’t expect these extremist candidates to just go away.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: We see all over the globe that holding an election doesn’t guarantee a real democracy.  We need to fiercely defend the integrity of our elections to ensure that all of our citizens have an equal voice in shaping our government. https://t.co/sjgvgc49zZ

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: Packing and cracking to dilute the voice of the minority, and state legislatures gerrymandering by taking governors and judges out of the election law process to bias the system are both are completely unacceptable if you believe in democracy and the integrity of elections.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: Both voting rights cases that SCOTUS has heard this year, Moore v. Harper and Merrill v. Milligan, have the potential to further erode the protections for our sacred right and freedom to vote. What’s at stake in these cases is the very foundation of our democratic republic.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: Challenges to the Voting Rights Act and attempts to erode protections to gerrymandering are a direct attack on voters, particularly Black and brown voters. These cases are about whether we each have an equal opportunity to shape the outcome of elections. https://t.co/aavAhNr4GJ

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: The most important thing we can do to make sure our courts work for the people—and something I’m focused on getting done in the Senate—is to get dark money OUT of politics. When the mega-rich can pour money into our elections unchecked, corruption follows.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: We’ve seen MAGA Republicans play the long game, loading our courts—all the way up to SCOTUS—with extreme judges who will do their party’s bidding. We need qualified judges on the bench who are dedicated to serving the people, not a conservative political agenda and corporations. https://t.co/mJWmn29CBn

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: I’m laser focused on fixing our broken Senate so that we can make progress on protecting our fundamental freedom to vote by passing bills like the John Lewis Voting Rights Act and the Freedom to Vote Act.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: With the minority veto created by the no-effort filibuster, there was no chance to get that bill through the Senate. I worked to get 50 Democrats on board with changes that would restore the Senate’s old style of doing business, but unfortunately in the end we fell 2 votes short.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: That bill, which became the Freedom to Vote Act, stops billionaires from buying elections, ends partisan gerrymandering, protects our freedom to vote, and stops officials from overturning election results. The attack on our democracy didn't end on 1/6. This bill is our defense.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: I wrote the For the People Act because the American people have a constitutional right to vote and to have a voice in the decisions that impact their lives. We in Congress need to protect that freedom, in service to the folks who elected us in the first place. https://t.co/cpZSBzq3ju

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: Every eligible American should have the right to vote and know that vote will be counted. With SCOTUS having gutted the Voting Rights Act and the Republican party on a hunt to block access to the ballot box, that right is in jeopardy.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: This is why I’m working toward federal protections for our freedom to vote. We can’t afford to fail—the ballot box is the beating heart of our democracy. Access to that ballot box hangs in the balance. GOP opposition is rooted in the Big Lie—I'm working to overcome it.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: What started with Trump’s Big Lie has continued in state legislatures around the country making it harder for their own citizens to vote, and even giving themselves the power to throw out their citizens’ votes.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: The damage didn’t end that day—it continued on in the form of unceasing attacks on our freedom to vote and the continuation of the Big Lie. In 2021 alone, 440 bills to restrict the right to vote were introduced across 49 states. 34 became law.

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text:
The #BreakFreeFromPlastic Pollution Act will:
♻️ Fix our broken waste and recycling systems
🏭 Hold corporations accountable for wasteful products and packaging
🗑️ Phase out unnecessary single-use plastics
🏘️ Protect our communities from toxic pollution from plastic production

name: Senator Jeff Merkley
tweet_text: We need more than awareness—we need action. Many states have already taken steps to tackle plastic pollution, and I introduced the Break Free from Plastic Pollution Act to build on the progress being made in individual states with a national commitment to #BreakFreeFromPlastic.
